title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: SpaceX share sale values IPO at $800B
items.author: Joey Roulette, Gursimran Mehar
items.summary:
- **SpaceX** is preparing for a possible 2026 IPO and has opened a secondary share sale that could value the company at **$800 billion**, with up to **$2.56 billion** of shares sold to investors.
- The funds would back expansion of *Starlink* and the *Starship* program, including plans for AI data centers in space, Moonbase Alpha, and Mars missions.
- Reuters, Bloomberg and others have floated a potential IPO as early as June 2026, but timing and valuation remain uncertain, with some reports suggesting a >$1 trillion figure.

items.title: SKF showcases intelligent, clean technologies for construction and mining at EXCON 2025
Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan bats for gradual semicon growth for India
AI won't steal jobs: Chandok's last-gen stability claim
items.summary: - *Chandok* says AI will not “steal” jobs but will *unbundle* them, making this generation the last with stable, long-term careers.\n- He warns the real pink slip is a refusal to *learn* and urges continuous skill updates as AI adoption grows.\n- Nadella adds that *data* is a strategic asset and Microsoft’s AI tools are used for cyber safety, signaling a shift to new skills and a portfolio of work.

items.title: Fully committed to India's semiconductor ecosystem: Japan
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury
items.summary:
- *Japan* commits to bolstering India's *semiconductor ecosystem*, offering cooperation in ecosystem development and *HR training*. 
- Keiichi highlighted collaboration with about 160 Japanese companies and visits to Tata Electronics facilities to push manufacturing in India. 
- The 2023 strategic partnership aims at resilient supply chains, boosting *R&D* and talent to reduce reliance on single sources like *China*.

items.title: Nestle India appoints former Pernod Ricard HR head Nitu Bhushan as its new HR chief
Nvidia considers increasing H200 chip output due to robust China demand
How tight supply, AI demand propelled copper towards $12,000
items.summary:
- Copper is nearing $12,000 per ton as **tight supply** and *AI-driven demand* converge.
- Widespread investment in *power grids*, data centers, and the energy transition is fuelling sustained copper demand.
- Analysts expect a demand-supply deficit and price support from macro flows and copper ETFs.

items.title: PTC India, NLC India form JV for 2,000 MW green energy
items.summary:
- *PTC India* and *NLC India Renewables Ltd* form a *joint venture* to explore up to **2,000 MW** of green energy projects, starting with around **500 MW** in the first phase.
- The JV will target project development, power trading, renewable energy park creation, and integration of solar, wind, hydro, battery energy storage systems, and green ammonia.
- Ownership is **74%** by *NLC India Renewables Ltd* and **26%** by *PTC India*, with board appointments and rights to sell power via regulated and competitive routes.

items.title: McCain Foods to invest ₹3,800 crore in MP plant
items.summary:
- McCain Foods to invest ₹3,800 crore in MP to establish a frozen *potato* products unit as an anchor in Agar Malwa's **Phase 3**.
- Land allotment covers around *70 acres* in Agar Malwa's **Phase 3**, with **₹1,800 crore** in the first phase.
- It aims to benefit *potato farmers* across *Malwa* by providing a stable market and boosting value addition, while creating jobs.

items.title: ICAR institutes develop ready-to-eat millet–soy snacks to tap healthy food market
AIIMS Delhi begins India’s first dedicated trial of advanced brain stent, eyeing affordable domestic production
Vadodara Jail inmates bag project: rehab success
items.author: Tushar Tere
items.summary:
- Inmates at *Vadodara Central Jail* are trained as skilled bag makers for **Safari Industries**, a rehabilitation oriented program.
- Production has surged from 10k–12k to ~55k bags monthly, with 210+ prisoners employed and a six-year contract in place.
- The unit now accounts for ~9% of Safari's output, paying prisoners ₹8,000–₹10,000 monthly and boosting employability.

items.title: Manufacturing stress may hit TN's GSDP
items.summary: - *Tamil Nadu* manufacturing requires urgent attention to safeguard *GSDP*, says N Jagadeesan of the Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry.\n- TN slipped from 3rd to 15th in manufacturing, yet accounts for about *9%* of India's exports, highlighting the need to bolster *manufacturing* for growth.\n- MSMEs produce over 8,000 products and TN hosts 12 of India's 100 smart cities, signaling strong potential for industry and trade.

items.title: China's smaller manufacturers look to catch the automation wave
Maharashtra to sign $2B bio-methanol plant deal in Chandrapur
items.author: Shishir Arya, TNN
items.summary:
- *Maharashtra to sign a $2B deal with a US company to set up one of the world's largest bio-methanol plants in Chandrapur‑Gadchiroli.*
- *The project would be among only two such units in the country, with a banana-stem *fibre* plant planned in Bhusawal and another facility in *Trichy*, Tamil Nadu.*
- *Anbalagan touted the state’s new industrial policy and bamboo bio-feedstock push as catalysts to attract hundreds of billions in investment, driving growth and value-chain development.*

items.title: SAIL posts 14% growth in sales in Apr-Nov
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- SAIL recorded **12.7 MT** sales in *April–November 2025*, up **14% YoY** from **11.1 MT** in the prior period. 
- Retail sales reached **0.97 MT**, up **13% YoY**; in *November* overall sales rose **27% YoY** and retail surged **69% YoY**. 
- As a government-owned group with **five integrated plants**, SAIL attributed the gain to a **strong sales strategy** amid price pressures and volatility.

items.title: India’s hydrogen demand likely to double to 12 mtpa by 2030: Nuvama report
India–Mexico FTA talks begin amid looming tariff hikes
items.summary:
- The *India–Mexico FTA talks* have begun as Mexico plans up to 50% tariffs on non-preferential imports starting January 1.
- Officials say the *terms of reference* will frame negotiations, with India seeking *mutually beneficial solutions* to safeguard exporters.
- The talks occur within the *USMCA context* and global trade rules, aiming for a timely pact to ease trade imbalances.

items.title: Drop in land acquisition won't setback Aerospace Park
items.summary:
- *MB Patil* said dropping 1,777 acres in Devanahalli as a 'Permanent Special Agricultural Zone' is not a setback for the **Aerospace & Defence Park**.
- Karnataka accounts for about **65%** of India’s aerospace output, with Belagavi–Hubballi and BMIC boosting the ecosystem.
- Belagavi will get an industrial park after talks with *Satish Jarkiholi*, and a defence corridor proposal with Rajnath Singh is being considered.

items.title: Indian Link Chain to Acquire Majority Stake in RRP
items.summary:
- *Indian Link Chain Manufacturers Ltd* is acquiring a majority stake in *RRP Electronics*, enabling entry into *semiconductors*, *electro-optics*, *medical devices* and other high-technology sectors.
- The Mumbai-based firm will own the majority stake in *RRP Electronics Ltd* after completion of the acquisition, which is at an advanced stage, with financial details not disclosed.
- *RRP Electronics* specialises in OSAT services from chip packaging to electronics manufacturing and the deal will see *Indian Link Chain Manufacturers Ltd* renamed *RRP Electronics India Ltd* on completion.

items.title: Private companies may be kept out of Uranium mining
items.author: Shilpa Samant, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- A committee's report published in October says *India's private sector* should be encouraged to participate in local uranium production, with appropriate safeguards.
- It notes that domestic uranium mining and processing can be *three to four times more expensive* than the international price.
- The article discusses whether *private firms* will be kept out of uranium mining amid nuclear-energy legislation like the **Atomic Energy Bill 2025**.

items.title: Huawei's latest smartphone uses improved China-made chip, report shows
Nvidia emerges as challenger to Cisco, Arista in Ethernet switch market in 3Q25: IDC
Steel structures are powering the next wave of India's data centre growth
US launches Pax Silica coalition, minus India
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The US launches *Pax Silica*, a plan to secure the global *silicon supply chain* from **critical minerals** to AI and semiconductors, with *India* notably absent.
- The inaugural Summit convenes partners from Japan, SK, Singapore, Netherlands, UK, Israel, UAE and Australia to bolster the AI supply chain.
- Experts say India lacks the *critical edge technology* and minerals to join Pax Silica and pursues separate partnerships with UAE, Singapore and Japan.

items.title: India second-biggest Russian fossil fuel buyer after China
items.author: Sanjeev Choudhary, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *India* imported ₹3.3 billion of Russian fossil fuels in November, ranking second to *China* with ₹5.4 billion, per CREA.
- November growth was led by crude oil ₹2.6 billion and coal ₹457 million, while October stood at ₹3.1 billion; refined products rose to ₹236 million.
- Sanctions and tariff pressures, including US measures, are starting to affect Russian oil flows and revenues.

items.title: EV shift to redefine India’s aftermarket and manufacturing playbook
Tata Steel to boost capacity by 50% to maintain market lead
Nvidia to boost H200 output amid Chinese demand
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* is weighing adding production capacity for its *H200* AI chips after orders from *China* surged beyond current output.
- The move comes as U.S. export controls and a potential 25% fee on H200 sales to China are being discussed, with Trump signaling possible allowances.
- Chinese buyers such as *Alibaba* and *ByteDance* are showing strong interest, while regulators may link purchases to domestic-chip conditions.

items.title: PLI scheme boosting manufacturing, investments and exports: Jitin Prasada
Odisha to roll out land-lease policy for renewables
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Odisha will lease land for renewable energy projects for **25 years** at nominal rates to speed up project clearances. 
- The policy is in draft and slated for implementation within **two months** after stakeholder vetting, targeting **solar, hydro, green hydrogen and green ammonia** to meet **RPOs**. 
- Odisha has identified over **160 sites** for small hydro and is promoting rooftop solar subsidies under **PM Surya Ghar Yojana**, along with floating solar and agro-PV projects.

items.title: Make in India: PT Usha calls on govt. to promote manufacturing of anti-doping kits in India
Waaree expands 1.5 GW at Samakhiali
items.summary:
- *Waaree Energies* expands its *Samakhiali* plant with an additional *1.5 GW* of solar module capacity, strengthening domestic production.
- The site now totals *3 GW* annual module capacity, supplemented by two 750 MW lines, with global solar module capacity at *22.3 GW* (India ~ *19.7 GW*, US 2.6 GW) and *5.4 GW* solar cell capacity.
- The expansion reinforces Waaree's strategy to deliver *locally manufactured solar technologies* at scale across key markets, including *India*.

items.title: Intel has tested chipmaking tools from firm with sanctioned China unit
PLI schemes attract ₹2 lakh crore investment till September, lift output and jobs across sectors
Why Mexico slapped 50% tariff on India, how it matters
Xpeng to partner with EPMB for Malaysia EV plant in 2026
items.summary:
- Xpeng teams with *EPMB* to start mass *EV production* in *Malaysia* in 2026, its third base outside China.
- It will use *EPMB*'s capacity to make *Malaysia* a strategic hub for expansion into the broader right-hand-drive *ASEAN* market.
- Details on output and models weren't disclosed as production scales up amid price pressure and trade barriers.

items.title: China to regulate steel exports with a licence system
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - *China* will roll out a licence system for steel exports from 2026 to help balance *global supply* and address a rising protectionist backlash.\n- About 300 steel items will require licences tied to export contracts and manufacturer quality certificates; a 2025 list already covers 43 categories of goods subject to **export licences**.\n- Some analysts say the near-term impact may be limited, but the policy could pave the way for stricter regulation and lasting effects on global steel trade.

items.title: Apollo Tyres earns A- CDP rating
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Apollo Tyres* secured an **A-** rating in the CDP for *Climate Change* and *Water Security*, reflecting disclosure, risk assessment and progress.
- It began reporting to CDP in 2020 with a D score, rose to **B-** in 2023, and reached **A-** in 2025 in both categories.
- The company commits to net-zero by 2050 and will soon disclose near-term emission reductions in its decarbonisation plan.

items.title: Russia's diamond miner ALROSA sees India as a key partner
Renewable energy adoption rises in Indian textile sector, but intensity-related challenges persist: Report
Mexico's tariffs to hit India's auto, auto components, metal, electronics exports: Experts
Lloyds Engineering forms new defence unit to tap indigenous manufacturing push
Lupin Manufacturing Solutions, PolyPeptide tie up to strengthen global peptide supply chain
India's drone & space-tech boom to add 2L jobs by 2033
items.summary:
- The sector is projected to grow to **$44B by 2033** and create **over 2 lakh jobs** for engineers, researchers, and data scientists.
- Growth is driven by government reforms, private-sector participation, and international collaborations in *aerospace*, *drones*, and *space-tech*.
- Regions like *Bengaluru*, *Hyderabad*, *Chennai*, *Ahmedabad*, and *Pune* will drive opportunities, with niche roles earning a **20-30% premium**.

items.title: US should sign trade deal if happy with offer: Piyush Goyal
items.summary:
- **Piyush Goyal** said the US should sign the trade deal if they are very happy with India’s offer.
- Talks have had five rounds, with a US delegation visiting to push negotiations and finalise the first tranche of the **Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA)**.
- There is optimism on the **EU-India FTA** timeline, but Goyal did not set a deadline for the BTA, stressing a fair, win‑win outcome.

items.title: CCI tells liquor bodies to desist from anti-competitive conduct
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The CCI ordered three wine and liquor associations to desist from *anti-competitive conduct* and unfair conditions on manufacturers, distributors and sellers of alcoholic beverages. 
- It found practices like issuing circulars to influence pricing, margins, discounts, payment terms, and no-objection certificates for new products violate *antitrust rules* and warned of possible recidivism and harsher consequences for office-bearers. 
- No penalties were imposed yet, but office-bearers could be personally liable under *Section 48* of the Competition Act, 2002.

items.title: Reliance Retail likely targets 2028 IPO; prepares leaner and sharper footprint
PM Modi speaks to US president Donald Trump as bilateral trade agreement talks progress
